Questions.question: Narayan Kartikeyan is the sportsman in the field of ?
Questions.information: Narain Karthikeyan (born 14 January 1977) is a racing driver who was the first Formula One driver from India. He has previously competed in A1GP, and the Le Mans Series.

Questions.question: Which of the following awards is not associated with the field of sports ?
Questions.information: Gyanpeeth Award is an Indian literary award presented annually by the Bharatiya Jnanpith to an author for their "outstanding contribution towards literature".

Questions.question: What is the name given to an animal that only eats plants ?
Questions.information: Herbivores are animals that eat only plants. Carnivores are animals that eat only meat. Omnivores are animals that eat both plants and meat.

Questions.question: Which artist painted the Mona Lisa ?
Questions.information: Mona Lisa, also called Portrait of Lisa Gherardini, wife of Francesco del Giocondo, oil painting on a poplar wood panel by Leonardo da Vinci, probably the world's most famous painting.

Questions.question: What instrument does a doctor use to learn about heart beats ?
Questions.information: Using a stethoscope, your doctor can listen to your lungs for signs of congestion. The stethoscope also picks up abnormal heart sounds that may suggest heart failure.

Questions.question: What is the first letter of the Greek alphabet ?
Questions.information: The word "alphabet" comes from the first two letters of the Greek alphabet "alpha" and "beta".

Questions.question: What Is The Full Version Of NASA ?
Questions.information: NASA was started on October 1, 1958, as a part of the United States government.

Questions.question: How many heart/s does an octopus have ?
Questions.information: An octopus has three hearts, nine brains, and blue blood. Two hearts pump blood to the gills, while a third circulates it to the rest of the body.

Questions.question: What is the national motto of India ?
Questions.information: Satyamev Jayate is a part of a mantra from the Hindu scripture Mundaka Upanishad.

Questions.question: Richter Scale is used to measure ?
Questions.information: The Richter magnitude scale is a scale of numbers used to tell the power (or magnitude) of earthquakes. Charles Richter developed the Richter Scale in 1935.

Questions.question: The blue colour of the clear sky is due to ?
Questions.information: A clear cloudless day-time sky is blue because molecules in the air dissipate blue light from the sun more than they dissipate red light.

Questions.question: What is three dimensional image called ?
Questions.information: In computers, 3-D (three dimensions or three-dimensional) describes an image that provides the perception of depth.

Questions.question: What is an 11 sided shape called ?
Questions.information: In geometry, a hendecagon (also undecagon or endecagon) or 11-gon is an eleven-sided polygon.

Questions.question: who wrote vande mataram ?
Questions.information: Vande Mataram is a Sanskrit poem written by Bankim Chandra Chatterjee in 1870s, which he included in his 1882 Bengali novel Anandamath.

Questions.question: Whatâ€™s the white bit in the middle of the egg called ?
Questions.information: Egg white is the clear liquid (also called the albumen or the glair/glaire) contained within an egg.
